content: Rohan, initial blood results are in and the news is excellent. ApoB has dropped further to 81 mg/dL. You're on the cusp of your Q2 goal of <80. hs-CRP also remains suppressed. Outstanding progress.
That's fantastic to hear, Warren. Thanks for keeping me posted 🙏. Encouraging to see the effort translating into numbers.
Morning Rohan, I’ve updated your tracker with the results Warren shared. VO₂ test confirmed Wed 9:30am, DEXA on Thu 2pm. Both reminders are in your calendar.
Perfect, thanks Ruby. Wed 9:30 and Thu 2pm noted 👍.

Rohan, alongside the physical diagnostics, we’d like to establish a cognitive baseline. A 15-min validated online test will let us quantify focus, memory and processing speed. Shall I coordinate with Ruby?
Makes sense, Advik. Please go ahead and loop Ruby in to schedule.
Got it—link to the cognitive assessment will be in your inbox today. It takes ~15 mins and can be done anytime before Fri. Would evening work best?
Yes, evenings are better. Will slot it in tomorrow night after dinner.
Completed the cognitive test just now. Straightforward interface, no issues.
Thanks for confirming Rohan, results are syncing to your dashboard. Advik will interpret and share context during Fri’s debrief with Warren.
Checking in—did the VO₂ Max test go smoothly this morning?
Yes, done ✔️. Pushed hard, felt controlled. Curious to see where I landed.
Excellent—data is with Rachel already. We’ll compile into the long-term performance brief after your DEXA tomorrow.
All set—DEXA completed and uploaded. That’s the last piece of your 6-month diagnostics ✅.
Nice. Feels good to wrap the panel. Appreciate how smooth the process has been.
Rohan, based on VO₂ and DEXA, here are your 12-month performance targets: 1) VO₂ Max → 45 mL/kg/min, 2) Body fat → 18%, 3) +5 lbs lean mass. This is your Longevity Decathlon brief.
Clear and ambitious, Rachel. Like the framing of a 'decathlon'—gives me a north star.
Quick one Rachel—looking at my next strength block. I like deadlifts but concerned about injury risk as weight climbs. Alternatives?
Great point. Swap in trap bar deadlifts—they mimic the same movement pattern but shift load mechanics to reduce lower-back stress. Safer, equally effective.
Appreciate that. One nuance: since trap bar feels more squat-like, do we lose posterior chain benefit, or does neural drive from heavy lifts keep systemic effect similar?
Good question 👌. Yes, trap bar recruits more quads, but posterior chain is still highly engaged. Heavy loading still stimulates systemic neural and hormonal responses. Net benefit is preserved.
Makes sense. Thanks for the clarity.
Morning Rohan, reminder: your debrief call with Warren + team is today at 5pm. Link is in your calendar invite.
Got it, thanks Ruby. Will be ready at 5.

Rohan, to summarise: blood markers continue to improve (ApoB ↓, CRP stable). VO₂ and DEXA give us clear baselines. Cognitive test establishes Pillar 5. You’ve now got a fully co-created, data-anchored plan.
That’s exactly what I was hoping for, Warren. Clear, measurable targets across all fronts.

Rohan, we’ve officially integrated 'Pillar 5: Cognitive & Mental Health' into your Elyx plan. Weekly piano practice + quarterly cognitive assessments are now formal KPIs. This makes your plan a living document.
Love that it’s evolving with my goals. Thanks for capturing it so seamlessly, Neel.

Rohan, quick note—DEXA shows your lean mass distribution is solid. To push VO₂ and fat % goals, I suggest slightly increasing daily protein (1.8 g/kg). Cook can integrate with simple swaps if you’d like?
Yes, let’s adjust. Please send 2–3 easy swaps for my cook to integrate.
Done—emailed Sarah a one-pager with: 1) swap white rice for quinoa twice weekly, 2) add edamame as side, 3) Greek yogurt for dessert. Easy integration.
Perfect, thanks Carla. These seem very doable.
Just wrapped all updates into your Elyx dashboard. Decathlon targets, cognitive pillar, nutrition tweaks—all visible now. Steady state till next labs.
Appreciate the quick consolidation, Ruby 🙏. Great to see it all in one place.
Rohan, preliminary cognitive results: processing speed ~75th percentile, working memory ~70th. Good starting point—we’ll track quarterly to see impact of piano and other habits.
Solid baseline. Excited to see if training moves those numbers upward over time.
Rohan, you’ve now reached a key milestone: full 6-month diagnostic cycle completed. The co-created plan, with 5 pillars, positions you strongly for 2026.
Feels like a real step forward, Neel. Thanks to the whole team for making this structured yet flexible.
Happy to hear that, Rohan 😊. We’ll keep you steady and sharp through Dec. Next check-in: quarterly labs in Feb unless anything urgent arises.
Sounds good, Ruby. Appreciate how on top of everything you all are.
